entry.title: MDT Database Scripts
entry.content:
I recently dusted off a Powershell script that I wrote to do a batch upload of computer records to a MDT database. It builds on Powershell modules provided by Michael Neihaus. My original LoadComputers.ps1 script reads in a csv file and does some basic data validation before creating the new records.

My reason for dusting off this script was to delete a batch of computers. I modified the logic and that became the DeleteComputers.ps1 script.

These scripts can most certainly use some more polish, and will need modified to fit the particular environment they are being used in. I hope they might give someone else a good starting point.

Go to the repo

entry.title: ConnectShares script
entry.content:
I have added an example script for mounting network shares automatically on startup for and Active Directory bound Mac. This script uses the Distiquished Name (DN) of the user to determine what shares should be mounted for the user.

The repository is here, and includes a plist that can be used to implement the script as a LaunchAgent. Go here for instructions on packaging this up with The Luggage.

entry.title: ZCM Install Script
entry.content:
I have added my ZCM install script to my github account. This is a vbs script that I use to make the ZCM installer more friendly in the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit.

The script is here.

To use the script, place it in a directory with the PreAgent install exe and import into MDT as an application with source files. Set the install command to cscscript install.vbs

A more extensive explanation of the development of the script can be found in this blog post.

entry.title: Welcome to my Github Page
entry.content:
Welcome to my Github page. I set this up primarily as a means to experiment with Octopress as a blog platform. I hope to add posts here to accompany scripts that I share on github.

See my main blog at Nuts and Bolts
